result.execSummary:
The defendant James Darnell Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay victim witness surcharge and all costs, assessments and surcharges, DNA surcharge. FAILURE TO PAY ALL COSTS ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES WILL RESULT IN ENTRY OF CIVIL JUDGMENT.
Court advised defendan that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
No further violations of the law.

Follow all rules of probation.
Absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens.
Other counseling needs to be determined.
Provide DNA sample and pay all applicable costs. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: Perform 30 hours of community service at a non-profit agency

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Darnell Ward in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The court has not received a report from supervising agent.  The defendant has not had any violations.
The court will STAY the House of Correction time to the end of probationary period.
No reply from surety or defendant.
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($50.00) ad
CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED TO COSTS, ASSESSMENTS, SURCHARGES
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Ineligible Voting Acknowledgement; Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant James Darnell Ward in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 17.
Sentencing statements by counsels and defendant.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction; credit for 5 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-Serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction STAYED for review on 3-9-2015 at 8:15.
-Follow all rules of probation.
-No further violations of the law.
-AODA assessment and any treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Random urine screens.
-Maintain employment.
-Other counseling needs to be determined.
-Perform 30 HOURS of community service at a non-profit agency.
-Provide DNA sample and pay all applicable costs.
-Pay victim witness surcharge and all costs, assessments and surcharges, DNA surcharge.
FAILURE TO PAY ALL COSTS ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES WILL RESULT IN ENTRY OF CIVIL JUDGMENT.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated October 7, 2014, received and filed.

Defendant James Darnell Ward in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Jury Trial. Case proceeds to Plea Hearing.  
AS TO COUNT  - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing on 10-8-2014 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
